bug.author: xiongjun19
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h2>üêõ Bug</denchmark-h>
I'm trying to use fairseq under torch1.5 version, but failed to build with setup.py script. <denchmark-h:h3>To Reproduce</denchmark-h>
run command: python setup.py build_ext -i and the output is: the error info is: torch/include/torch/csrc/api/include/torch/nn/cloneable.h:44:65: error: invalid static_cast from type ‚Äòconst torch::OrderedDict<std::basic_string, at::Tensor>‚Äô to type ‚Äòtorch::OrderedDict<std::basic_string, at::Tensor>&‚Äô /home/dev/anaconda3/envs/tor15/lib/python3.7/site-packages/torch/include/torch/csrc/api/include/torch/nn/cloneable.h:56:59: error: invalid static_cast from type ‚Äòconst torch::OrderedDict<std::basic_string, at::Tensor>‚Äô to type ‚Äòtorch::OrderedDict<std::basic_string, at::Tensor>&‚Äô torch::OrderedDict<std::basic_string, std::shared_ptrtorch::nn::Module >‚Äô to type ‚Äòtorch::OrderedDict<std::basic_string, std::shared_ptrtorch::nn::Module >&‚Äô /home/dev/anaconda3/envs/tor15/lib/python3.7/site-packages/torch/include/torch/csrc/api/include/torch/nn/cloneable.h: In instantiation of ‚Äòstd::shared_ptrtorch::nn::Module torch::nn::Cloneable::clone(c onst c10::optionalc10::Device&) const [with Derived = torch::nn::EmbeddingBagImpl]‚Äô: /tmp/tmpxft_00008f72_00000000-5_edit_dist.cudafe1.stub.c:225:27: required from here /home/dev/anaconda3/envs/tor15/lib/python3.7/site-packages/torch/include/torch/csrc/api/include/torch/nn/cloneable.h:44:65: error: invalid static_cast from type ‚Äòconst torch::OrderedDict<std::basic_string, at::Tensor>‚Äô to type ‚Äòtorch::OrderedDict<std::basic_string, at::Tensor>&‚Äô torch::OrderedDict<std::basic_string, at::Tensor>‚Äô to type ‚Äòtorch::OrderedDict<std::basic_string, at::Tensor>&‚Äô torch::OrderedDict<std::basic_string, std::shared_ptrtorch::nn::Module >‚Äô to type ‚Äòtorch::OrderedDict<std::basic_string, std::shared_ptrtorch::nn::Module >&‚Äô torch::nn::Cloneable::clone(c onst c10::optionalc10::Device&) const [with Derived = torch::nn::EmbeddingImpl]‚Äô: /tmp/tmpxft_00008f72_00000000-5_edit_dist.cudafe1.stub.c:225:27: required from here comments.comment: this is not fairseq's fault, the issue caused by pytorch 1.5, any one encounter same problem can refer to <denchmark-link:https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/pull/37221>pytorch_issue</denchmark-link>
